snippet: Coroners’ inquests are finding fresh support from some people critical of the process that cleared police officers in killings in Ferguson, Mo., and Staten Island.
abstract: Coroner's inquests are being supported by public officials and civil rights advocates across United States in cases involving fatal police shootings; inquests, which do not indict officers or determine guilt, take place before trial, offering more public forum for inquiry than usual closed proceedings that critics say shelter officers.
lead_paragraph: Coroners’ inquests are finding fresh support from some people critical of the process that cleared police officers in killings in Ferguson, Mo., and Staten Island.

headline.main: A More Public Option for Investigating Shootings by Police Officers
headline.print_headline: Offering a More Public Option for Investigating Shootings by Police Officers
